results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil
results.brief_description: The geographic features of Brazil and their relationship to such important crops as coffee, cotton and cacao; Brazil as a land of impenetrable jungle, fertile farmlands, gigantic plantations, rich mineral resources, thriving industry and big cities. Includes a sequence on Brasilia, the new capital.

results.title: Geography of South America: Argentina, Paraguay, Uraguay
results.brief_description: The geographic factors influencing the economy and life of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, pointing out that the three nations of the Plata-Parana River system are rich in flat and rolling lands suitable for farming and grazing. Some of the achievements and problems of these countries are also discussed.

results.title: Geography of Australia
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the geography of Australia; surrounding oceans; its area, rainfall and wind systems resulting in various climatic regions, temperature variations; main mineral resources and the uses to which these resources are put; chief rural industries. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Education Department Western Australia and Ray Costello
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.

results.title: Gentlemen prefer blondes (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Sol Siegel and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend” Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russel and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

results.title: Gentleman's agreement [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Phil Green (Gregory Peck) is a single father and journalist lured to New York as a feature writer for a magazine. Assigned to write about anti-semitism, he struggles to find the right angle from which to explore this issue from a more personal perspective. Unrelenting in his quest for truth, Phil poses as a Jew and encounters prejudice first hand. Determined to expose intolerance and hypocrisy, he confronts those who blatantly practice anti-semitism and challenges those close to him who support it by remaining silent. Includes original theatrical trailer and Movietone News footage. Cast also includes Dorothy McGuire, John Garfield, Celeste Holm, Anne Revere, June Havoc and Dean Stockwell. Screenplay by Moss Hart, based on the original story by Laura Z. Hobson. Cinematography by Arthur Miller. Music by Alfred Newman. (Academy Awards: Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: Gentle strangers
results.brief_description: A drama concerning a Thai girl who comes to Australia to study. Provides an insight into some of the problems faced by Asian students in our country.

results.title: Genius: Leonardo Da Vinci
results.brief_description: The brilliance and legacy left by Renaissance man, Leonardo Da Vinci, as thinker, sculptor, painter, engineer and inventor, lives on today. One of the most important figures in modern history, Da Vinci not only achieved legendary status within his own lifetime with his work, but was also to influence the future of both science and art. Freed from the constraints of Medieval culture, Da Vinci had free reign to explore and develop his ideas. He had very intense interests with solutions that challenged the scientific notions of the day in anatomy, engineering and architecture. Whilst reviving the nature of ‘true scientific discovery’, he opened up ‘observation’ as a method of scientific and medical discovery. A cross-disciplinary figure of epic proportions, whose legacy has seeped into the public consciousness and includes such inventions as: the clock (with arms for minutes and hours), camera obscura, the system of gears, cogs and weights to name only a few. Aided by 3-D graphics, this documentary explores the complexities and insights that shaped Da Vinci’s work.
